channel.title: Most Touching/Favorite Movies
channel.description:
Hey,
I don't know what it is about getting a Video iPod, but it just makes me want to get tons of movies to put on it... Anyways, I figured I'd start this thread so that people can share their favorite movies, like ones they would put on their iPods.
My Favs:
American History X [img]http://www.vip-blog.com/medias/1105/344616american_history_x.jpg[/img] This movie really touched me. I actually wrote a 5 page essay on equality after reading this.
Kidulthood [img]http://www.theangelsoundclash.com/splash_images/kidulthood_800x500_xt_fw.jpg[/img] One of my favorites.
Kids [img]http://www.impawards.com/1995/posters/kids.jpg[/img] This movie is insane. It really leaves you thinking about life, and the people you know.
Thirteen [img]http://www.impawards.com/2003/posters/thirteen.jpg[/img] A lot like the two above, just a bit more modern.
Fight Club [img]http://re3.mm-a1.yimg.com/image/2152268762[/img] This was my favorite movie for a long time, and is still one of my favorites.
Carlito's Way [img]http://losbirro.altervista.org/carlitos%20way.jpg[/img] The whole thing I think is sick.
Scar Face [img]http://www.allgoods.ca/store/images/al%20pacino%20scar%20face.gif[/img] This movie is a classic. I don't think I really need to say more.

item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:

[/quote]

Tropa de Elite is also like it, again from Brazil.

Its pretty good too, although I dont think they have any with English sub.[/quote]

Might give it a watch. Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Most Touching/Favorite Movies
item.dc:creator: @DigiSphere DigiSphere
item.description:
@DigiSphere wrote:

A touching collection would be the invasion of Iwo Jima island movies, looking at it from either side, it is fairly touching knowing that the people are willing to die for their country, the one that is from the Japanese version is fairly touching, the men devote their lives to a country they know will not win the war yet they still try to push on.

Anyway:

Flags of our fathers,
Letters from Iwo Jima.

Read full topic
